reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Rockaway for a week in Jan 2012. The hotel has all the makings of a great little place - cheap cabanas perfect for travellers, and more sturdy aircon rooms for people who can afford the jump in price.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you value sleep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the cabana's as a travelling couple on our late 20's. They were rustic, but cheap at 250 pesos per night. They came with mosquito nets and a private bathroom inside, so we thought we had a bargain.
reviews.title: Cheap, nice and close to the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem with this hotel is the noise. They are doing major building works on site - building a new block I think - and this starts every day (except Sundays) at 7.30am on the dot. Being in a cabana you can hear everything, so it's a constant banging and drilling noise early in the morning every day.
reviews.title: Great location and very quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only did we have to contend with being woken up early, there is also a group of aging surfer dudes who prop up the Rockaway bar every night. They are loud, quite rude and stay up until the early hours of the morning, sometimes 2am - 3am.
reviews.title: Awesome location and great value

reviews.text: On the first night we ventured out to the bar and sat down, only to be told we were "sitting on someone's stool" (there was nobody there) and we had to move. The general atmosphere at the bar is very cliquey and does nothing to encourage guests interaction. It's the same group there every night, getting drunk and generally being loud.
reviews.title: Great value in an excellent location!
